4 (4-ounce) skinless salmon fillets

1 cup ricotta

2 tablespoons olive oil, divided

Zest and juice of 2 lemons, divided

2 tablespoons basil, chopped

Salt, to taste

Blck pepper, to taste

12 asparagus spears, trimmed

Pesto olive oil

Preheat oven to 400 degrees, and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.\n
In a small bowl, combine ricotta, one tablespoon of olive oil, juice and zest of one lemon, chopped basil, and salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.\n
Brush salmon fillets with olive oil. Season with salt. Place some ricotta mixture on each of the fillets and top with asparagus spears. Roll salmon and secure with toothpicks. Brush with remaining olive oil and top with salt.\n
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes until salmon is tender and golden. Remove from oven and top with remaining lemon juice and zest. Brush with pesto olive oil and serve immediately.
